titleStmt.title: Dispatch to John E. Taylor, February 7, 1855

bibl.title: Dispatch to John E. Taylor, February 7, 1855
Despatches from United States Consuls in Sierra Leone, 1858-1906 T-438

div1.opener:
Flag Ship Constitution
Off Gambia River Febry 7th 1855
John E. Taylor
Acting Consul of the
United States at
Sierra Leone
Sir,
div1.p: I am directed to acknowledge the receipt of your letter of September 12th 1854, addressed to the Commander in Chief of the African Squadron.

The Western Coast of Africa is of great extent and there are at present, in this Squadron but three vessels of , it is therefore impossible to comply with your request that one of them should visit Sierra Leone at least once or twce in every two months.

The Commodore has written to the Government renewing his statement of the necesity for an American Consulate at Sierra Leone, and has recalled the attention of
of the Secretary of the Navy to a former despatch in which he reported of the appointment he had conferred upon you, and urged its confirmation.

closer.salute:
By order of Comm. Mayo
I have the honor to be
Very Respectfully
Your Obdt Servt
